title: How can I get a copy of my discharged?
question: I filed chapter 7 in state of California in 2012. I received my discharged few month later. Unfortunately, I cannot find my discharge form. Please let me know how I can request copy from the court. I need information such as web site, form name and number etc.
answers:
Your attorney can look for it under your name, SSN, or case number using PACER. If you do not have an attorney, I think you can google PACER, and set up your own account.

Good luck.

Kind regards

Your prior BK atty can access PACER where all the docs are stored
the URL is https://pacer.login.uscourts.gov/cgi-bin/login.pl
What is your case number (in the Southern District) ... I will email you a copy of your Discharge.
Best to contact your attorney and have them pull a copy from their file or go to PACER.gov
It appears that this link may be helpful for purposes of requesting that document. Or, contact your attorney, if you had one. https://www.casb.uscourts.gov/content/recordscase-information JCC

If you filed in the San Diego area, you might be able to look up your case by your name on https://www.casb.uscourts.gov/, which is for the U.S. Bankruptcy Court, Southern District of California.

You will need a PACER account which you should be able to set up if you have a way to pay electronically.

If you can't set up the PACER account, you could call the clerk of court for the U.S. Bankruptcy Court where you filed, and ask how to get a copy. The phone number should be on the website.
